items.title: Aanwezigheid zoontjes Jota maakt Liverpool - Wolves extra emotioneel
items.summary: De twee zoontjes van Diogo Jota zullen zaterdag het veld oplopen tijdens het op voorhand emotionele Premier League-duel tussen Liverpool en Wolverhampton Wanderers op Anfield, de twee oude clubs van hun vader. De BBC maakt hier vrijdag melding van, in navolging van The Times .

items.title: Premier League, EFL and Afcon buildup and John Robertson tributes ‚Äì matchday live
items.summary: ‚öΩ All the latest ahead of today‚Äôs festive fixtures ‚öΩ John Robertson, Forest and Scotland legend, dies aged 72 ‚öΩ Fixtures | Tables | Follow us on Bluesky | Mail Tom A reminder that this is what CFG‚Äôs chairman, Khaldoon al-Mubarak, said back in 2019 when they bought Mumbai City: We believe this investment will deliver transformative benefits to Mumbai City FC, to City Football Group and to Indian football as a whole. City Football Group is committed to the future of football in India and to the potential for Mumbai City FC within that future. We are very much looking forward to playing an active role in Mumbai City FC‚Äôs fan and local communities, and working with our co-owners to further develop the club as quickly as possible. items.title: Diogo Jota‚Äôs two sons to join mascots at Anfield for Liverpool v Wolves
items.summary: Late Portuguese‚Äôs former English clubs meet on Saturday Dinis and Duarte also attended clubs‚Äô season openers Diogo Jota‚Äôs two sons will join the mascots at Anfield when Liverpool face Wolves in the Premier League on Saturday, the club confirmed on Friday. The Portuguese forward, who played for both Premier League clubs, died in a car crash alongside his younger brother in July in northwestern Spain. He was 28. Continue reading...

items.title: This will be the Premier League's quietest Boxing Day ever: Where did all the games go?
items.summary: The day after Christmas is usually jam-packed with great Premier League matchups, but not this year. What gives?

items.title: Arteta 'hacked off' by Rice's time-wasting red card
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has revealed he was "hacked off" by Arsenal's draw with Brighton & Hove Albionlast season but hailed his side's improved disciplinary record this term.

items.title: Forest's 'greatest' John Robertson dies at 72
items.summary: Former Nottingham Forest and Scotland winger John Robertson has died at the age of 72, the Premier League club have announced.

items.title: Richards on U.S., Palace return: 'Won't be long'
items.summary: United States defender Chris Richards said it "won't be long" until he's back for Crystal Palace.

items.title: Amorim: Mainoo is the 'future of Manchester United'
items.summary: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim has insisted Kobbie Mainoo represents the future of the club but may have to wait for his chance to prove it.

items.title: Havertz near to Arsenal return with Arteta hoping for ‚Äòdifferent dimension‚Äô in attack
items.summary: Forward underwent knee surgery in August Arteta: ‚ÄòIt will be a matter of days, not weeks‚Äô Mikel Arteta hopes Kai Havertz is ready to return from a long-term knee injury and has predicted the German will bring ‚Äúa different dimension‚Äù to Arsenal‚Äôs attack. Havertz has been sidelined since undergoing knee surgery in August and had been expected back at the start of December before a setback in his rehabilitation. The 26-year-old was Arsenal‚Äôs top scorer in the Premier League last season with nine goals despite missing several months with a hamstring issue. He was pictured training this week and Arteta revealed Havertz had been ‚Äúquite close‚Äù to being considered for the Carabao Cup quarter-final win over Crystal Palace on Tuesday. Continue reading...

items.title: Parma coach Carlos Cuesta: ‚ÄòLeaving Arsenal was maybe the most difficult decision of my life‚Äô
items.summary: Spaniard, who at 30 has been coaching for half his life, discusses Arteta, tactics and how to win players‚Äô trust Carlos Cuesta, towards the end of his first major interview, briefly lets himself wonder how far his journey will take him. ‚ÄúMaybe one day it brings the Maldives,‚Äù he says with a laugh, the joke being football managers can quickly be banished from view, twiddling their thumbs on the beach, once their star has faded. Still, would that be so bad? ‚ÄúIt could be better or worse, it depends when or why. If it‚Äôs because you want it, or if it‚Äôs because somebody told you to go.‚Äù If soaking up rays sounds like anathema to Cuesta it is because, in a remarkable ascent, he has barely wasted a minute. In June, shortly before turning 30, he took the reins at Parma and became the youngest head coach in Serie A since 1939. Half of his short life had been spent building up to that moment, the realisation crystallising in his late teens that no other calling would do. ‚ÄúI felt that I needed to coach,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt was like an inner necessity that I had inside of me.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: The Next Sarina: maak kennis met de Nederlandse coach die de CL won
items.summary: Als 2025 voor iemand een bijzonder jaar is geworden is het wel voor Ren√©e Slegers. De pas 36-jarige manager van de vrouwen van Arsenal wilde eigenlijk in de schaduw werken om te leren en ervaring op te doen, maar werd in januari benoemd tot hoofdcoach. In mei won ze de Champions League.

items.title: NAC wil gebrek aan doelpunten tackelen met Amoah en Diba
items.summary: NAC Breda voegt Matthew Amoah en Anouar Diba toe aan de technische staf. De twee oud-aanvallers van de Eredivisie-club gaan zich vanaf januari bezighouden met het begeleiden van de aanvallers in de selectie van trainer Carl Hoefkens.

items.title: Premier League-debutanten op rapport: Frimpong valt tegen, een 8 voor Brobbey
items.summary: In Rondje Boxing Day geven kenners buitenlands voetbal S√ºleyman √ñzt√ºrk en Bas van den Hoven de Nederlandse debutanten in de Premier League een rapportcijfer op basis van de eerste seizoenshelft. In dit fragment komen Jeremie Frimpong en Brian Brobbey aan bod.

items.title: Jota's sons to join mascots for Liverpool v Wolves
items.summary: Diogo Jota's sons will accompany the matchday mascots as the Portuguese's two former sides - Liverpool and Wolves - meet for the first time since his death.

items.title: John Robertson was a ‚Äòscruffy, unfit‚Äô genius who did not get the kudos he deserved | Ewan Murray
items.summary: Forest great was loved in Nottingham but under-appreciated in Scotland before going on to thrive as a coach On the eve of a Celtic European tie 25 years ago, Stiliyan Petrov cut an increasingly agitated figure. The young midfielder, soon to shoot to prominence under Martin O‚ÄôNeill, was finding it impossible to snatch the ball from a rotund, wizened coach during a possession drill. Petrov‚Äôs teammates were cackling with laughter. John Robertson‚Äôs brilliance was understated enough in Scotland. Word of his talent in the game was never likely to reach Petrov as he grew up in deepest Bulgaria. Petrov is part of a recent generation who owe a debt of gratitude to Robertson the coach. More of them later. When news of Robertson‚Äôs death filtered through on Christmas Day, the prevailing sense was that his country had lost one of a kind. He was also an individual who, for reasons associated with his own modesty, really never received the kudos he deserved in the land of his birth. Continue reading...

items.title: Higuita doet 'Scorpion Kick' dertig jaar na dato nog eens over
items.summary: Ren√© Higuita gaat dertig jaar na zijn beroemde Scorpion Kick op Wembley wederom de wereld over. In een afscheidswedstrijd voor Mario Yepes deed de excentrieke doelman het nog eens dunnetjes over.

items.title: From 'mothballed' to MCG cauldron ‚Äì Bethell handed 'hiding to nothing'
items.summary: No 3 has been a problem position for England in The Ashes with Ollie Pope struggling for form and his replacement Jacob Bethell was dismissed for just one on a 20-wicket opening day of the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne.

items.title: Emotional Kelce ponders retirement after Chiefs' home finale
items.summary: Travis Kelce has confirmed he is still pondering retirement from NFL after potentially playing his last home game for Kansas City Chiefs.

items.title: Jokic makes NBA history with 56-point triple-double
items.summary: Nikola Jokic recorded a 56-point triple-double and set an NBA record with 18 points in overtime, leading the Denver Nuggets to a 142-138 win over the Minnesota Timberwolves on Christmas Day.

items.title: Wissa: There's more to come from me, Newcastle is my destiny
items.summary: Newcastle striker Yoane Wissa has promised there is more to come from him after an injury ravaged start to life on Tyneside.
